specJson.name: brightics.function.clustering$mean_shift
specJson.description:
Mean shift clustering aims to discover “blobs” in a smooth density of samples. It is a centroid-based algorithm, which works by updating candidates for centroids to be the mean of the points within a given region. These candidates are then filtered in a post-processing stage to eliminate near-duplicates to form the final set of centroids.

Deciding appropriate value of `bandwidth` is important. Inappropriate `bandwidth` can cause modes to be merged, or generate additional “shallow” modes. The best cases to use mean shift clustering are 1) when there are not too many data because it would take lots of calculating time, 2) when we cannot predict the distribution of data so that we do not know how many clusters would be created. Application domains include cluster analysis in computer vision and image processing.

params.label: Input Columns
params.description: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible.

params.label: Bandwidth
params.description: Window size used in the RBF kernel. It has a physical meaning unlike 'k' of K-Means. If None, the bandwidth is estimated using a heuristic.

params.label: Bin Seeding
params.description: If true, initial kernel locations are the location of the discretized version of points (by binding points into grid), therefore algorithm will be speeded up.

params.label: Minimum Bin Frequency
params.description: To speed up the algorithm, accept only those bins with at least minimum bin frequency points as seed.

params.label: Cluster All
params.description: If true, then all points are clustered, even those orphans that are not within any kernel. Orphans are assigned to the nearest kernel. If false, then orphans are given cluster label -1.

summary.en: This function is a Mean Shift Clustering model which is a nonparametric clustering algorithm.
summary.ko: 비모수 군집 알고리즘인 평균 이동 군집 모델입니다.

md.en: # Mean Shift This function is a Mean Shift Clustering model which is a nonparametric clustering algorithm. ## Description Mean shift clustering aims to discover 'blobs' in a smooth density of samples. It is a centroid-based algorithm, which works by updating candidates for centroids to be the mean of the points within a given region. These candidates are then filtered in a post-processing stage to eliminate near-duplicates to form the final set of centroids. Deciding appropriate value of `bandwidth` is important. Inappropriate `bandwidth` can cause modes to be merged, or generate additional “shallow” modes. The best cases to use mean shift clustering are 1) when there are not too many data because it would take lots of calculating time, 2) when we cannot predict the distribution of data so that we do not know how many clusters would be created. Application domains include cluster analysis in computer vision and image processing. Reference - - ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) A table that contains input `table`'s column and prediction column as `Prediction Column Name`. 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Mean Shift Clustering model. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible. 2. **Prediction Column Name**: Column name for prediction. 3. **Bandwidth**: Window size used in the RBF kernel. It has a physical meaning unlike 'k' of K-Means. If None, the bandwidth is estimated using a heuristic. 4. **Bin Seeding**: If true, initial kernel locations are the location of the discretized version of points (by binding points into grid), therefore algorithm will be speeded up. 5. **Minimum Bin Frequency**: To speed up the algorithm, accept only those bins with at least minimum bin frequency points as seed. 6. **Cluster All**: If true, then all points are clustered, even those orphans that are not within any kernel. Orphans are assigned to the nearest kernel. If false, then orphans are given cluster label -1. 7. **Group By**: Columns to group by. ### Python #### USAGE ``` mean_shift(table = , input_cols = , prediction_col = , bandwidth = , bin_seeding = , min_bin_freq = , cluster_all = , group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) Training data in a Table. #### OUTPUT 2. **model**: (Model) Trained Mean Shift Clustering model. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: Columns to select as input. Only values in numeric type are possible. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **prediction_col**: Column name for prediction. * Type: *str* * Default value: prediction 3. **bandwidth**: Window size used in the RBF kernel. It has a physical meaning unlike 'k' of K-Means. If None, the bandwidth is estimated using a heuristic. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: None (value > 0) 4. **bin_seeding**: If true, initial kernel locations are the location of the discretized version of points (by binding points into grid), therefore algorithm will be speeded up. * Type: *bool* * Default value: False 5. **min_bin_freq**: To speed up the algorithm, accept only those bins with at least minimum bin frequency points as seed. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 6. **cluster_all**: If true, then all points are clustered, even those orphans that are not within any kernel. Orphans are assigned to the nearest kernel. If false, then orphans are given cluster label -1. * Type: *bool* * Default value: True 7. **group_by**: Columns to group by. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** In this tutorial workflow, sample_iris data is used to Mean Shift Clustering. The generated model is afterward applied to a test dataset to predict the cluster by using Mean Shift Predict function. The parameter settings used in the function are shown below. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 3. **Bandwidth**: 1 4. **Bin Seeding**: False 5. **Minimum Bin Frequency**: 1 6. **Cluster All**: True 7. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import mean_shift input_table = inputs[0] result = mean_shift(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], prediction_col='prediction', bandwidth=None, bin_seeding=False, min_bin_freq=1, cluster_all=True, group_by=None) output = result['model'] ``` In this python script, sample_iris data is used to train an Mean Shift Clustering. The generated model is afterward applied to a test dataset to predict the cluster by using Mean Shift Predict function.
md.kr: # 평균 이동 이 함수는 nonparametric clustering 알고리듬인 Mean shift clustering model을 훈련한다. ## Description Mean shift clustering 알고리듬은 샘플 데이터의 분포에서 덩어리를 찾아낸다. 이 알고리듬은 영역 내에서 포인트의 평균을 계산하여 무게중심의 후보군을 업데이트 하고 후처리 단계에서 중복을 제거하여 최종 무게중심 집합을 결정한다. 이 알고리듬은 적절한 'bandwidth'값을 결정하는 것이 중요하다. 'bandwidth'가 적절히 선택되지 않으면 최빈값이 병합되거나 추가적으로 '얕은' 최빈값이 생성될 수 있다. Mean shift clustering은 계산 시간이 많이 걸리기 때문에 데이터가 너무 많지 않은 경우 데이터 분포를 예측할 수 없어서 생성 될 클러스터 수를 알 수 없는 경우에 사용하기 좋다. Reference - - ## Properties ### VA #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 트레이닝 데이터. #### OUTPUT 1. **out_table**: (Table) 예측 컬럼을 포함하는 결과 테이블. 2. **model**: (Model) 훈련된 Mean Shift Clustering 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **Input Columns***: 인풋으로 선택할 컬럼. 숫자형 데이터만 가능. 2. **Prediction Column Name**: 예측 컬럼 이름. 3. **Bandwidth**: RBF 커널의 윈도우 크기. 4. **Bin Seeding**: true로 설정하면 이산화 된 점 버전의 위치를 초기 커널 위치로 이용해서(점을 격자에 바인딩하여) 알고리즘 속도가 빨라진다. 5. **Minimum Bin Frequency**: miniumum bin frequency 이상의 값을 가지는 bins만 시드로 사용하여 알고리듬 속도를 향상한다. 6. **Cluster All**: true이면 kernel에 속하지 않은 점을 가장 가까운 커널에 할당하여 모든 점을 클러스터링 한다. false이면 kernel에 속하지 않은 점에는 -1인 레이블을 지정한다. 7. **Group By**: 그룹화 컬럼. ### Python #### USAGE ``` mean_shift(table = , input_cols = , prediction_col = , bandwidth = , bin_seeding = , min_bin_freq = , cluster_all = , group_by = ) ``` #### INPUT 1. **table***: (Table) 트레이닝 데이터. #### OUTPUT 2. **model**: (Model) 훈련된 Mean Shift Clustering 모델. #### PARAMETER 1. **input_cols***: 인풋으로 선택할 컬럼. 숫자형 데이터만 가능. * Type: *list[str]* 2. **prediction_col**: 예측 컬럼 이름. * Type: *str* * Default value: prediction 3. **bandwidth**: RBF 커널의 윈도우 크기. * Type: *float* * Default / Range: None (value > 0) 4. **bin_seeding**: true로 설정하면 이산화 된 점 버전의 위치를 초기 커널 위치로 이용해서(점을 격자에 바인딩하여) 알고리즘 속도가 빨라진다. * Type: *bool* * Default value: False 5. **min_bin_freq**: miniumum bin frequency 이상의 값을 가지는 bins만 시드로 사용하여 알고리듬 속도를 향상한다. * Type: *int* * Default / Range: 1 (value >= 1) 6. **cluster_all**: true이면 kernel에 속하지 않은 점을 가장 가까운 커널에 할당하여 모든 점을 클러스터링 한다. false이면 kernel에 속하지 않은 점에는 -1인 레이블을 지정한다. * Type: *bool* * Default value: True 7. **group_by**: 그룹화 컬럼. * Type: *list[str]* * Default value: None ## Example ### VA **[Sample Model]** 이 예제에서는 sample_iris 데이터를 이용해서 Mean Shieft Clustering 모델을 훈련한다. 훈련된 모델은 Mean Shift Predict 함수를 이용해서 데이터 클러스터를 예측하는데 사용될 수 있다. 예제에 사용된 파라미터 설정은 아래와 같다. ++Parameters++ 1. **Input Columns***: sepal_length, sepal_width 2. **Prediction Column Name**: prediction 3. **Bandwidth**: 1 4. **Bin Seeding**: False 5. **Minimum Bin Frequency**: 1 6. **Cluster All**: True 7. **Group By**: None ### Python ``` from brightics.function.clustering import mean_shift input_table = inputs[0] result = mean_shift(table=input_table, input_cols=['sepal_length', 'sepal_width'], prediction_col='prediction', bandwidth=None, bin_seeding=False, min_bin_freq=1, cluster_all=True, group_by=None) output = result['model'] ``` 이 예제에서는 sample_iris 데이터를 이용해서 Mean Shieft Clustering 모델을 훈련한다. 훈련된 모델은 Mean Shift Predict 함수를 이용해서 데이터 클러스터를 예측하는데 사용될 수 있다.
